prompt.prompt:
The dot plot below is a name length visualization created by a group of 25 students (Group C). 

 ![](./names3.png) 

<!-- -->

 Select **all** of the True statements below.
distractors: The difference (in letters) between the longest name and the shortest name is 8.
More than half of the students' names have fewer than 5 letters.

answer: The most common name length is 5 letters.
There are no students with 6-letter names.

prompt.prompt:
Consider how the dot plot below would be different if the student named Sebastian weren’t in the class. 

 ![](./names2.png) 

<!-- -->

 Select each statement below that correctly describes a new dot plot of the class’ names without Sebastian.
distractors: There are no gaps in the display.

answer: Without the dot representing Sebastian, the range is 4 letters.
The most common name length (6 letters) is also the longest name length.

prompt.prompt:
Over the course of a four-week period... 

 Shana wore blue jeans on 25 days and shorts on 3 days. 

 Clara wore a dress for 8 days, khaki pants for 10 days, and shorts for 10 days. 

 Olivia wore black pants on all 28 days.  

  Who had the greatest variability in their clothing selection during the four-week window?
distractors: Shana and Clara tied for the greatest variability
